attributes.name: BaseSound
attributes.description: This is the base sound object from which other sound objects are derived.

attributes.name: HLS
attributes.description: This class connects with HLS.js to create sounds.

attributes.name: Howler
attributes.description: This class connects with Howler to create sounds.

attributes.name: NativeAudio
attributes.description: This class connects with the native audio element to create sounds.

attributes.name: hifi
attributes.description: This is the hifi service class.

methods.name: init
methods.description: When the Service is created, activate connections that were specified in the configuration. This config is injected into the Service as options.

methods.name: availableConnections
methods.description: Returns the list of activated and available connections

methods.name: load
methods.description: Given an array of URLS, return a sound ready for playing

returns.description: A sound that's ready to be played, or an error

params.name: urlsOrPromise
params.description:
[..]
Provide an array of urls to try, or a promise that will resolve to an array of urls

methods.name: play
methods.description: Given an array of URLs, return a sound and play it.

returns.description: A sound that's playing, or an error

params.name: urlsOrPromise
params.description:
[..]
Provide an array of urls to try, or a promise that will resolve to an array of urls

methods.name: pause
methods.description: Pauses the current sound

methods.name: stop
methods.description: Stops the current sound

methods.name: togglePause
methods.description: Toggles play/pause state of the current sound

methods.name: toggleMute
methods.description: Toggles mute state. Sets volume to zero on mute, resets volume to the last level it was before mute, unless unless the last level was zero, in which case it sets it to the default volume

methods.name: fastForward
methods.description: Fast forwards current sound if able

methods.name: rewind
methods.description: Rewinds current sound if able

methods.name: setCurrentSound
methods.description: Set the current sound and wire up all the events the sound fires so they trigger through the service, remove the ones on the previous current sound, and set the new current sound to the system volume

methods.name: _setCurrentSoundForPosition
methods.description: Sets the current sound with its current position, so the sound doesn't have to deal with timers. The service runs the show.

methods.name: _registerEvents
methods.description: Register events on a current sound. Audio events triggered on that sound will be relayed and triggered on this service

methods.name: _unregisterEvents
methods.description: Register events on a current sound. Audio events triggered on that sound will be relayed and triggered on this service

methods.name: relayEvent
methods.description: Relays an audio event on the sound to an event on the service

methods.name: _activateConnections
methods.description: Activates the connections as specified in the config options

methods.name: _activateConnection
methods.description: Activates the a single connection

methods.name: _lookupConnection
methods.description: Looks up the connection from the container. Prioritizes the consuming app's connections over the addon's connections.

returns.description: a local connection or a connection from the addon

methods.name: _resolveUrls
methods.description: URLs given to load or play may be a promise, resolve this promise and get the urls or promisify an array/string and

returns.description: a promise resolving to a cleaned up array of URLS

methods.name: _findFirstPlayableSound
methods.description: Given an array of strategies with {connection, url} try the connection and url return the first thing that works

returns.description: A sound that's ready to be played, or an error with a failures property

methods.name: _prepareParamsForLoadWorkingAudio
methods.description: Given some urls, it prepares an array of connection and url pairs to try

methods.name: _prepareMobileStrategies
methods.description:
Take our standard strategy and reorder it to prioritize native audio first since it's most likely to succeed and play immediately with our audio unlock logic

we try each url on each compatible connection in order [{connection: NativeAudio, url: url1}, {connection: NativeAudio, url: url2}, {connection: HLS, url: url1}, {connection: Other, url: url1}, {connection: HLS, url: url2}, {connection: Other, url: url2}]

methods.name: _prepareStandardStrategies
methods.description:
Given a list of urls, prepare the strategy that we think will succeed best

Breadth first: we try each url on each compatible connection in order [{connection: NativeAudio, url: url1}, {connection: HLS, url: url1}, {connection: Other, url: url1}, {connection: NativeAudio, url: url2}, {connection: HLS, url: url2}, {connection: Other, url: url2}]

methods.name: _prepareStrategies
methods.description: Given a list of urls and a list of connections, assemble array of strategy objects to be tried in order. Each strategy object should contain a connection, a connectionName, a url, and in some cases a sharedAudioAccess

methods.name: _createAndUnlockAudio
methods.description: Creates an empty audio element and plays it to unlock audio on a mobile (iOS) device at the beggining of a play event.

methods.name: _attemptToPlaySoundOnMobile
methods.description: Attempts to play the sound after a load, which in certain cases can fail on mobile

attributes.name: hifi-cache
attributes.description: This class caches sound objects based on urls. You shouldn't have to interact with this class.

attributes.name: PromiseRace
attributes.description:
Given an array of params, this will go through the list one-by-one and call your callback function until your function calls returnSuccess, at which point the main Promise will resolve with that thing you passed it.

The callback should have the following arguments (nextParam, returnSuccess, markAsFailure)

Your callback should do what it needs to do and if that thing is good, pass it to returnSuccess. If that thing is bad call markAsFailure
